intro: Galeopsis bifida var. emarginata, commonly known as narrowleaf hedge nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually narrow and toothed. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers in whorled clusters, which are typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found along roadsides and in meadows. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
